page.title: 19Attitudes
page.content: Our poor, hardworking police force Have so very much to do - No time for golf or tennis Like rich farmers such as you! {Interview with an Old Villager } Louise and I did a project for our school. We had the job of interviewing Mrs E. Peever, who is the oldest person in the village of Dudleston Heath being born in the last century. The question we asked her is what do you think of the village today? Her answer was I think it has improved. The roads are in good condition, we have water laid on to every house. We all have electricity, even for cooking. I think the people of today do not know how fortunate they are. Most people possess a car, chidren own bicycles. All have television sets. We have a modern
